Authors: Kusumajati D.A., Chairiyani R.P., Martoredjo N.T.
Title: The Influence of Social Media on Human Behavior in Adolescents (Case Study of Bina Nusantara University Students)
Affiliations: Character Building Development Center, Information System Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Character Building Development Center, Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Character Building Development Center, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kusumajati, D.A., Character Building Development Center, Information System Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Chairiyani, R.P., Character Building Development Center, Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Martoredjo, N.T., Character Building Development Center, Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The use of social media at this time cannot be separated from the needs of the community, in this case, they are teenagers. The use of social networks by students generates positive and negative behavioral changes. This study measures the effect of social networks on the behavior of human values in adolescents. The research subjects were active students studying at Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta. The purpose of this study was to determine the effect of social media on human behavior in adolescents.This research uses non-experimental quantitative methods. Data obtained from social media and human behavior measurement tools and have been tested on 473 students. The population in this study were active students at Bina Nusantara University. The results showed that there was an influence between social media and human behavior in social aspects and diversity. This means that the higher the use of social media by students increases the influence in social activities together with other people from various aspects of the background. © 2020 ACM.
Index Keywords: Behavioral research; Big data; Social aspects; Social networking (online); Students; Behavioral changes; Human behaviors; Human values; Quantitative method; Research subjects; Social activities; Social media; University students; Economic and social effects

Title: Parenting model of working mothers on their digitally native teenagers in using gadgets
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Affiliations: Primary Teacher Education, Faculty of Humanities, Character Building Development Center, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; English Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Chairiyani, R.P., Primary Teacher Education, Faculty of Humanities, Character Building Development Center, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Winiharti, M., English Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: In most part of the world nowadays, people-including parents and teenagers – are quite connected through the internet, especially through electronic devices such as computers and smartphones. Therefore, it is interesting to explore how teenagers nowadays use their gadgets and how their parents control this use. This study aims to investigate the parenting models of working mothers on their digitally native teenagers in using gadgets. The participants of this study are mothers who work outside their home. They are asked questions with regard to their teenagers’ using gadgets by means of interview techniques. The method used for analysis is qualitative and descriptive one. The results show that in doing their parenting, working mothers basically apply democratic style. This style encourages children to discuss what they want, thus there is cooperation between parents and children. In addition, children are perceived as individuals, therefore, parents should provide guidance and direction. As a result, the control on the use of gadgets is still provided. © IJSTR 2019.
Author Keywords: Digitally native teenager; Gadget; Parenting model; Working mother

Authors: Chairiyani R.P., Winiharti M., Irawan I.
Title: The use of Facebook for national integration by Bina Nusantara University students
Affiliations: Character Building Development Center, Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; English Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Character Building Development Center, Computer Science Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Chairiyani, R.P., Character Building Development Center, Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Winiharti, M., English Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Irawan, I., Character Building Development Center, Computer Science Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: A number of young people in Indonesia has Facebook account as their social media. It is used not only to link to their friends but also to obtain information. However, the rapid development of Facebook use has not only a positive impact but also a negative one. One that should be a concern is that the truth of the information posted in Facebook is not always accountable. Several users are likely to trust the information posted even though it is not reliable. As a result, it is not uncommon that the information on Facebook can actually make the disintegration on the nation. Therefore, this study is conducted to describe how Facebook can be used by young people to make Indonesian nation more integrated. The informants are nine students of Bina Nusantara University who are selected randomly. The data are collected using interview technique based on nine relevant questions. Then the data are analyzed using the theory of Uses and Gratifications. The results show that social media such as Facebook can be used by university students as a tool to maintain and develop Indonesian's national integration. They can also manage not to allow such media to make the nation disintegrated. This result implies that when social media is used wisely and positively, it supports the nation for sustainable integration. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Disintegration; Integration; Students; Facebook; Indonesia; It supports; Social media; Sustainable integrations; University students; Uses and gratifications; Young peoples; Social networking (online)

Authors: Chairiyani R.P., Herawati E., Widayanti R.E.
Title: The role of Mass Media to construct cosplayer self identity, social reality and hyper reality
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 10th International Conference on Human System Interactions, HSI 2017
Affiliations: Character Building and Development Center, Primary Teacher Education Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Business Law, Faculty of Humanaties, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Management School of Business, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Chairiyani, R.P., Character Building and Development Center, Primary Teacher Education Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Herawati, E., Business Law, Faculty of Humanaties, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia; Widayanti, R.E., Management School of Business, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta Barat, Indonesia
Abstract: Mass Media have been acknowledged as a mean to shape the way people view the world. It indeed constructs the individual and social world. The evolution of human thinking is always changing as the development of media technology. Human creates communication technology as a tool to overcome the obstacles in communication. However, these tools are eventually shape human perspective to view the world. One of the content that people can see in mass media is culture. It spread massively through various mass media as a product and content. Through the mass media people can see other culture. From the culture they have seen in mass media, they eventually construct their own culture. One of the culture they have formed is cosplay. Therefore, this research is questioning about to what extent the mass media role had construct the reality of self-identity and social world of cosplayer. Secondly, how mass media had developed the hyper reality of cosplayer which it's reflected in cosplayer behavior. This paper had done with qualitative analysis. It means that the analysis did from the beginning until the end of the research. The result of this research shows that mass media, especially of video game and film have significant role to develop the cosplayer hyper-reality and identity. Those bring the cosplayer choose the character that represents their self-identity to play. Through this new identity, cosplayer forms the community to share their experience. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Construction of self-identity and social reality; Cosplayer; Hyper-reality; Mass media role
Index Keywords: Communication technologies; Cosplayer; Human perspectives; Hyper-reality; Mass media; Media technology; Qualitative analysis; Social reality; Human computer interaction
Funding Text 1: This study was supported by Bina Nusantara University Grant

Authors: Sasmoko, Herisetyantri I., Suroso J.S., Harisno, Ying Y., Rosalin K., Chairiyani R.P., Pane M.M., Permai S.D.
Title: Am I a well being teacher? (A review of subjective wellbeing for elementary teachers)
Authors with affiliations: Sasmoko, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Herisetyantri, I., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Suroso, J.S., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Harisno, Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Ying, Y., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Rosalin, K., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Chairiyani, R.P., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Pane, M.M., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia; Permai, S.D., Bina Nusantara University, Indonesia
Abstract: One of Indonesia's government efforts to enhance the quality of education is to do certification program and qualification test for teachers. These programs are expected to have a positive outcome which is a better and increased teachers' competence. On the other hand, teacher's well-being might be disturbed by a negative impact from the program. This research aims to seek the subjective wellbeing of teachers in Jakarta and how to help teachers reach its wellbeing. The method use Neuroresearch (mix method), a mixture of qualitative research to build a theoretical construct and also observation as well as in-depth interviews with various parties and quantitative method by using measurement instruments subjective well-being Likert scale. The results found that (1) elementary teachers tend heading to wellbeing significantly at á <0.05 and (2) the cognitive dimension of teachers is an absolute determinant in shaping the well-being of primary school teachers. When a teachers cognitive is improved, then the wellbeing of primary school teachers will be increased by 20.983 from the current conditions. The study also found that the cognitive dimension is determined by the role of family situations and affective quality of teachers capable of acting 13.150 alters cognitive quality teachers. Recommendation from the results of this research is the need for new policies to change the model of teacher competency test that can empower cognitive competencies and simultaneously improve the conditions of teacher's family as the foundation of its economy. © Serials Publications.

Authors: Willyarto M.N., Pane M., Chairiyani R.
Title: Mathematics learning method of bar modeling for elementary school students
Authors with affiliations: Willyarto, M.N., Bina Nusantara University11530, Indonesia; Pane, M., Bina Nusantara University11530, Indonesia; Chairiyani, R., Bina Nusantara University11530, Indonesia
Abstract: Discrepancy of knowledge among students, teachers and schools to some extent has contributed in developing the negative attitude that says mathematics is hard. Therefore, the author tries to explain a method for teaching mathematics (especially for elementary school students), to be easily understood by students. As a result, mathematics is no longer perceived hard. One good method of learning mathematics is the use of models (bar modeling). The author conducted research by providing two different treatments, without bar modeling and with bar modeling, to the elementary school students. The result showed that the use of bar modeling has increased students’ scores significantly. Bar modeling is not the only method of teaching at the elementary level, and it is easier for elementary school students in learning mathematical concepts of symbolization in problem solving. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers.
